dcterms:creator: B. Roberson
dcterms:description: A strategic game framework where two players allocate resources across multiple targets, with the goal of maximizing their respective outcomes.
dcterms:title: Colonel Blotto game

dcterms:creator: G. Schwartz
P. Loiseau
S. S. Sastry
dcterms:description: An extension of the Colonel Blotto game that incorporates heterogeneous players with different resources and asymmetric valuations of targets.
dcterms:title: Heterogeneous Colonel Blotto game

dcterms:creator: D. Kahneman
A. Tversky
dcterms:description: A behavioral economic theory that describes how people make decisions under risk, emphasizing the cognitive biases that affect their choices.
dcterms:title: Prospect theory

dcterms:creator: D. Prelec
dcterms:description: A study on how individuals perceive probabilities, showing that they tend to overweight low probabilities and underweight high probabilities.
dcterms:title: Behavioral probability weighting

dcterms:creator: P. Guan
M. He
J. Zhuang
S. C. Hora
dcterms:description: A model that analyzes the interactions between an attacker and a defender in a multi-target setting, considering budget constraints for both players.
dcterms:title: Multi-target attacker-defender game

dcterms:creator: A. R. Hota
S. Sundaram
dcterms:description: A framework for analyzing security games on networks where the players' decisions are interdependent and influenced by behavioral probability weighting.
dcterms:title: Interdependent security games on networks

dcterms:creator: M. Abdallah
P. Naghizadeh
A. R. Hota
T. Cason
S. Bagchi
S. Sundaram
dcterms:description: An analysis of security investments in interdependent systems, incorporating both behavioral and game-theoretic perspectives using attack graphs.
dcterms:title: Behavioral and game-theoretic security investments
